required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Assess Food Effect on the Pharmacokinetics of Fimasartan in Healthy Male Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Open-labeled, Single Dosing Study to Assess Food Effect on the Pharmacokinetics of Fimasartan in Healthy Male Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: To assess food effect on the pharmacokinetics of fimasartan in healthy male volunteers.

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax, Tmax, AUC, T1/2, CL/F etc.

arm_group.description: Period 1: fed control → Period 2: fasted control
Period 1: fasted control → Period 2: fed control

intervention.description: Period 1: administration of fimasartan 240mg at 9:00am, 30 minutes after the breakfast Period 2: administration of fimasartan 240mg at 9:00am, without the breakfast
Period 1: administration of fimasartan 240mg at 9:00am, without the breakfast Period 2: administration of fimasartan 240mg at 9:00am, 30 minutes after the breakfast

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age: 20 - 45 years
- sex: male
- body weight: greater than 55 kg
- written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- known allergy to Fimasartan
- existing cardiac or hematological diseases
- existing hepatic and renal diseases
- existing gastrointestinal diseases
- acute or chronic diseases which could affect drug absorption or metabolism history of any serious psychological disorder
- abnormal diet which could affect drug absorption or metabolism
- positive drug or alcohol screening
- smokers of 10 or more cigarettes per day
- participation in a clinical trial during the last 60 days prior to the start of the study

clinical_study.keyword: To assess food effect on the pharmacokinetics of fimasartan in healthy male volunteers
